text: vir advertising is flipping traditional
advertising on its head for advertising
to be successful hello ladies people
have to watch the ad until the end and
then share the ad my goal was to
understand what ads are people viewing
and then up top of that what ads will
people share so what I did is I actually
got many people inside a lab I asked
them to fill out a personality
questionnaire and I showed them a series
of ads I allowed them to skip ads at any
point in time just as though they were
at home and while they were watching
these ads I used facial expression
analysis software to code their facial
reactions emotionality explains why
people are more likely to view some ads
versus the others but then when it comes
to sharing emotions just explain part of
the story and I couldn't really identify
why were people sharing some ads and not
the others just based on their facial
expressions I went back to look at their
personalities and try to understand why
people are sharing ads what I find is
that most ads are shared by people who
are self-interested versus altruistic
when you look at the content of these
ads they actually provide an incentive
for self-interested people to share in
nature in ecology there's a term for two
different species that are benefiting
from each other and that's called
symbiosis ad symbiosis advertising
symbiosis or viral symbiosis is this
actually this mechanism underlying uh
the creator of the ad content the brand
as well as the sharer the consumer both
benefiting by the process of sharing
these ads as a brand ask yourself what
do my consumers want to talk to um their
friends and their acquaintances about
and creating content that allows them to
have the social conversation and by the
way in the process delivering your
message and propagating your message is
a win-win situation for both the brand
and for the consumers because they
mutually benefit from this process of
sharing s
